column4: Also, in Gnome-terminal, I know Ubuntu supports the "ifconfig eth0" or whatever command. (I have a static network) so that means I'd have to manually configure eth0 all the time. But is there any easyer dialog-based way taht lets you enter the information? Because I find opening up /etc/resolv.conf etc to be a bit repetitive.

Especially having to type something like sudo ifconfig eth0 <IP.address up sudo route add default gw <IP.address sudo nano -w /etc/resolv.conf ..etc. Very repetitive entering information that way eaven from the Live CD>
